alert.note: Alert for Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 24 at 12:15AM CDT until June 24 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 AM MDT/315 AM CDT/ SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Nebraska, including the following county, Cherry. * WHEN...Until 215 AM MDT /315 AM CDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1115 PM MDT /1215 AM CDT/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Valentine, Smith Falls State Park, Highway 97 crossing the Niobrara River and Sparks. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
